place.name: EASTON MAUDIT
place.gazetteerText: EASTON-MAUDIT, a parish in Wellingborough district, Northampton; adjacent to Bedfordshire, 3 miles SSE of Castle-Ashby r. station, and 6½ S of Wellingborough. Post town, Yardley-Hastings, under Northampton. Acres, 1, 764. Real property, £1, 692. Pop., 207. Houses, 46. The property is all in one estate. Easton Park was formerly the seat of the Longuevilles and the Yelvertons. Limestone occurs. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £144.* Patron, Christ Church, Oxford. The church contains some ancient monuments; has a spire with flying buttresses; and was completely restored in 1861. Bishop Bercy was vicar. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
